title: Aberdeenshire whisky distillery workers vote to go on strike amid pay dispute - Aberdeen Live
text:
Workers at an Aberdeenshire distillery are among those set to go on strike amid an ongoing dispute about pay.
GMB Scotland members at Inver House Distillers have rejected a pay offer of 3% from bosses with locations including Knockdhu in Aberdeenshire, Speyburn in Moray, Balblair in Balmenach and Old Pulteney in the Highlands.
Warehouse workers in Airdrie are also included in the strike action.
25 people - 8% of Inver House Distillers' workers - are involved in the planned industrial action.

The union has asked for a 4% pay rise for their staff, saying that Inver House Distillers "must re-engage" in negotiations in order to avoid "inevitable" strike action.
Union organiser David Hume said: "They must re-engage with negotiations, return to the table and find a fair resolution.
"If they do not, industrial action is now inevitable."
A spokesperson for Inver House Distillers said: "We have been fair in our approach to negotiations and would reiterate that this year's pay rise was in line with inflation, as it is every year, and was accompanied by an annual bonus paid in December."
